meanings.sent1: The father decided to disinherit his son from receiving any money.
meanings.sent2: She feared her uncle might disinherit her from the family fortune.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to disinherit the dog from the cozy spot near the fireplace.
meanings.sent4: The storm threatened to disinherit the town of sunlight for days.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned the students that laziness could disinherit them from success.

meanings.definition: To deprive of a rightful inheritance.
meanings.sent1: The greedy relative schemed to disinherit the rightful heirs of their property.
meanings.sent2: The will was altered to disinherit the youngest sibling from the family estate.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to disinherit the birds from their favorite tree branch.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to disinherit the land of its usual vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules could disinherit anyone who broke them from their privileges.
